text:
I was surprised to find that this doesn't work:
```a = Vector{Float64}[]
# ERROR: MethodError: Cannot `convert` an object of type Float64 to an object of type Vector{Float64}
append!(a, [1.0, 2.0])```
What would be the idiomatic alternative?

elements.text: I was surprised to find that this doesn't work:
What would be the idiomatic alternative?

text: push! assuming you actually do want a vector of vectors

elements.text: push! assuming you actually do want a vector of vectors

text:
Maybe in retrospect the surprise is that
```b = Float64[]
append!(b, 2.0)```
actually works (instead of gives an error that 2.0 is not a collection)
